intro: Tylloma stolpii, commonly known as the stolpii thornapple, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, exhibiting succulent leaves adapted to conserve water. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, which bloom during the rainy season. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Tylloma stolpii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is relatively drought-tolerant.
